cartaPolicy.bookingGuidance: All Carta travel must be booked through Navan (access via OKTA). Obtain manager approval using the Trip Proposal feature before confirming bookings.
cartaPolicy.approvalWorkflow: Book domestic travel 21+ days and international travel 35+ days in advance. Travel booked less than 14 days from departure requires executive leader approval. All international travel requires Zip Approval from your Executive Leader.
cartaPolicy.expensePolicy: Economy class is standard. Premium Economy allowed on international flights over 6 hours. Hotel rates: $400/night (NYC, SF, London, Seattle), $250/night (Toronto, Singapore, SLC), $200/night (Manila, Rio), $150/night (Bangalore).
cartaPolicy.travelInsurance: Carta provides corporate travel insurance for international travel. Carry your insurance card. Contact #travel_and_expense_help on Slack for questions.
cartaPolicy.flightPolicy: Travelers must obtain lowest available non-refundable airfare. Extra legroom ($150 max round trip) allowed for domestic flights over 4 hours. In-flight WiFi and checked baggage fees are reimbursable.
cartaPolicy.mealAllowance: Daily meal allowance when visiting Carta offices (lunch provided): $70 (NYC, SF, London), $50 (Toronto, Singapore). When lunch not provided: $100 (NYC, SF, London), $80 (Toronto, Singapore). Travel days: $100 prorated.
cartaPolicy.groundTransportation: Preferred rideshare: Lyft/Uber. Car rental: Enterprise or National via Navan (midsize max unless 4+ people). Personal vehicle mileage reimbursed at IRS rate.
cartaPolicy.visaAndPassport: Passport maintenance is personal responsibility (not reimbursed). Carta reimburses visitor visas and immigration permits for business travel. Discuss with manager and obtain pre-approval for visa costs.
cartaPolicy.invitationLetterGuidance: Business invitation letters should be dated within 2 weeks of travel, signed by a manager in the receiving country. Present to immigration only if requested.

entry_authorization.headline: ESTA (Electronic System for Travel Authorization) required for Visa Waiver Program countries.
entry_authorization.details: Apply online at least 72 hours before travel. Valid for 2 years or until passport expires. Most applications approved within minutes.
entry_authorization.validity: Multiple entries for up to 2 years.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for 6 months beyond intended stay.

notes: ESTA does not guarantee entry - CBP officer makes final decision.
Business activities limited to meetings, conferences, negotiations - no paid work.
Carry invitation letter to present if requested by immigration.

entry_authorization.headline: B-1 Business Visa required for non-VWP countries.
entry_authorization.details: Schedule interview at US Embassy/Consulate. Processing times vary by location (2-8 weeks typical). Allow ample time before planned departure.
entry_authorization.validity: Usually issued for 10 years with multiple entries.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for 6 months beyond intended stay.

notes: Discuss with manager and obtain pre-approval for visa costs.
For full-service visa assistance, contact CIBTvisas (Carta's preferred provider).
Visa costs are reimbursable by Carta.

entry_authorization.headline: UK Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA) required for visa-exempt nationals.
entry_authorization.details: Apply via GOV.UK or the UK ETA app (takes ~10 minutes). Most decisions within 3 working days. Apply as early as possible.
entry_authorization.validity: Multiple entries for up to 2 years or until passport expires.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for the duration of stay in the UK.

recommended_documents: Carta business invitation letter (signed by UK manager)
notes: ETA is required even if transiting through the UK.
ETA does not permit work or productive activities.
Carry invitation letter from Carta UK to present if requested by Border Force.
Apply early - travel planning should account for possible delays.

entry_authorization.headline: No visa or ETA required for EU/EEA nationals for short business visits.
entry_authorization.details: Present valid passport or national ID at border. No pre-authorization needed.

passport_validity.rule: Passport or national ID must be valid for the duration of stay.

required_documents: Valid passport or national ID card
recommended_documents: Carta business invitation letter (signed by UK manager)
notes: Cannot work or access public funds during visit.
Business activities only - no productive work.

sources.title: Visit the UK as an EU citizen

entry_authorization.headline: US citizens do not need an eTA or visa for Canada.
entry_authorization.details: Present valid US passport at border. Entry granted at border officer's discretion.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for the duration of stay.

recommended_documents: Carta business invitation letter (signed by Canada-based manager)
notes: NEXUS card holders can use expedited lanes.
Business visitor activities only - cannot enter Canadian labor market.

entry_authorization.headline: Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA) required for visa-exempt travelers flying to Canada.
entry_authorization.details: Apply online. Most applications approved within minutes. Valid for 5 years.
entry_authorization.validity: Valid for 5 years or until passport expires.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for the duration of stay.

recommended_documents: Carta business invitation letter (signed by Canada-based manager)
notes: eTA not needed if entering by land or sea from the US.
For visa applicants, apply independently - refer to IRCC for processing times.
For full-service visa assistance, contact CIBTvisas.

entry_authorization.headline: Business Visitor Visa required for travel to Canada.
entry_authorization.details: Apply independently via IRCC. Processing times vary by location. Allow ample time before planned departure.
entry_authorization.validity: Varies - typically up to 10 years with multiple entries.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for the duration of stay.

recommended_documents: Carta business invitation letter (signed by Canada-based manager)
notes: Discuss with manager and obtain pre-approval for visa costs.
For full-service visa assistance, contact CIBTvisas (Carta's preferred provider).
Visa costs are reimbursable by Carta.

entry_authorization.headline: No visa required for short-term business visits (Schengen Area).
entry_authorization.details: Up to 90 days within any 180-day period across the entire Schengen Area.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for at least 3 months beyond planned departure from Schengen area.

required_documents: Proof of travel insurance (30,000 EUR minimum coverage)
notes: 90-day limit applies across all Schengen countries combined.
Travel insurance strongly recommended.
Track your days carefully if visiting multiple Schengen countries.

entry_authorization.headline: No visa required for short-term business visits.
entry_authorization.details: Present valid passport at immigration. Complete arrival card and customs declaration.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for the duration of stay.

notes: Visit Japan Web registration recommended for faster entry.
No paid work permitted on visa-free entry.
Complete arrival card on flight.

entry_authorization.headline: e-Visa required for US, Canadian, and Australian citizens.
entry_authorization.details: As of April 10, 2025, US, Canadian, and Australian citizens must obtain an e-Visa before traveling to Brazil. Apply online at brazil.vfsevisa.com. Processing time is approximately 5 business days. Fee is $80.90 USD.
entry_authorization.validity: Up to 10 years, 90 days per entry.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for at least 6 months.

recommended_documents: Carta business invitation letter (signed by Brazil-based manager)
Yellow fever vaccination certificate (if from affected areas)
notes: Apply at least 15 days before travel.
e-Visa valid for multiple entries up to 10 years.
Yellow fever vaccination may be required depending on origin country.
Daily meal allowance in Rio: $40 (when lunch provided), $50 (when not provided).

entry_authorization.headline: No visa required for Japanese citizens.
entry_authorization.details: Visa exemption for tourism and business visits up to 90 days. Can be extended to 180 days per year.
entry_authorization.validity: 90 days, extendable to 180 days per year.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for at least 6 months.

recommended_documents: Carta business invitation letter (signed by Brazil-based manager)
Yellow fever vaccination certificate (if from affected areas)
notes: Yellow fever vaccination may be required depending on origin country.
Register with Federal Police if staying over 90 days.

entry_authorization.headline: Canadian citizens do not need ESTA or a visa for the United States.
entry_authorization.details: Present valid Canadian passport at the border. Entry granted at CBP officer's discretion.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for the duration of stay.

notes: NEXUS card holders can use expedited lanes at land borders and airports.
Business visitor activities only - cannot enter US labor market.

entry_authorization.headline: No visa required for EU/Schengen nationals for business visits.
entry_authorization.details: Present valid passport at immigration. Up to 90 days within 180-day period.

passport_validity.rule: Passport must be valid for at least 6 months.

recommended_documents: Carta business invitation letter (signed by Brazil-based manager)
notes: Yellow fever vaccination recommended.
Business activities only - no paid work.
